content: Which side of docs#ennnorm_eq_of_real_abs should we prefer in lemma statements? At the moment we seem to use more of ennreal.of_real (abs x), but it's easier to work with ‖r‖₊ as there is no "unless it's negative then zero" side-condition.
I had a quick go in #19018 at switching the preference, which does seem like it will golf some proofs once the two missing nnreal lemmas are added.
(@Yury G. Kudryashov's recent change to prefer ‖r‖ over abs for is_R_or_C might be another argument in favor of a switch)
I would expect we should prefer coercion of nnnorm as you suggested.
